SEARCH
Module FloWeekTracker
Package com.floweektracker.service

Class WeekdayPlannerService

java.lang.Object
com.floweektracker.service.WeekdayPlannerService
public class WeekdayPlannerService extends Object
Singleton service for the WeekdayPlannerViewes. It is used to manage tasks in the weekday planner view.

FIELDS: service

CRUD METHODS: addTask(SingleTask), deleteTask(SingleTask), editTask(SingleTask, SingleTask)

GETTER METHODS: getWeekdayPlannerView(String),

OTHER METHODS: findIndexForNewTask(List, LocalTime), extractTimeFromTaskPanel(Component), isTaskInWeekdayPlanner(SingleTask), isTaskInWeekdayPlanner(WeekdayPlannerView, SingleTask), isComponentNameSame(JPanel, SingleTask), isComponentHasSameData(JPanel, SingleTask)

  • Constructor Details

    • WeekdayPlannerService

      public WeekdayPlannerService()

  • Method Details

    • addTask

      public boolean addTask(SingleTask task)
      Adds a given task to the compatible weekday planner view. Checks if the given task is null - if it is, it returns false. Then it creates a new task panel based on the given task name and then adds it to the weekday view's content panel. If there is any task, it localizes suitable index for the new task panel in content panel and inserts it at the correct position.
      Parameters:
      task - a given task which should be added to the appropriate weekday planner view
      Returns:
      true if the given task is successfully added, otherwise false
      See Also:
      • getWeekdayPlannerView(String)
      • isTaskInWeekdayPlanner(WeekdayPlannerView, SingleTask)
      • TaskAddingDialogController.addTask(SingleTask)
      • editTask(SingleTask, SingleTask)

    • deleteTask

      public boolean deleteTask(SingleTask task)
      Deletes a given task in the compatible weekday planner view. Checks if the given task is null or is not in the view - if it is, it returns false. Then it get content panel with task panels from the weekday planner view, finds the given task and removes it.
      Parameters:
      task - a given task which should be removes from the appropriate weekday planner view
      Returns:
      true if the given task is successfully remove, otherwise false
      See Also:
      • isTaskInWeekdayPlanner(WeekdayPlannerView, SingleTask)
      • getWeekdayPlannerView(String)
      • isComponentNameSame(JPanel, SingleTask)
      • MainPanelController.deleteTask()
      • MainPanelController.deleteTasksForWeekdays(List)
      • editTask(SingleTask, SingleTask)

    • editTask

      public boolean editTask(SingleTask task, SingleTask editedTask)
      Edits a given task in the compatible weekday planner view. Checks if a given task and editedTask are null, task is not in the view or editedTask is in the view - if it is, it returns false. Then it deletes the task and adds the editedTask to the weekday planner view. If it fails, it rollbacks the changes.
      Parameters:
      task - a given task which should be deleted from the appropriate weekday planner view
      editedTask - a given task which should be added to the appropriate weekday planner view
      Returns:
      true if the given task is successfully edited, otherwise false
      See Also:
      • isTaskInWeekdayPlanner(SingleTask)
      • deleteTask(SingleTask)
      • addTask(SingleTask)
      • MainPanelController.resetPoints(List)
      • TaskEditingDialogController.editTask(SingleTask, SingleTask)

    • getWeekdayPlannerView

      public WeekdayPlannerView getWeekdayPlannerView(String weekdayName)
      Parameters:
      weekdayName - a given weekday name which should be used to find the weekday planner view in the MainFrame.cardPanel
      Returns:
      a weekday planner view with the given weekdayName or null
      See Also:
      • addTask(SingleTask)
      • deleteTask(SingleTask)
      • isTaskInWeekdayPlanner(SingleTask)

    • isTaskInWeekdayPlanner

      public boolean isTaskInWeekdayPlanner(WeekdayPlannerView view, SingleTask task)
      Checks if a given task is in a given view. If any of the given parameters is null, it returns false. Then it gets task panels from the view's content panel and check if any of them has the same name and data as the given task.
      Parameters:
      view - a given weekday planner view whose task panels from its content panel should be checked
      task - a given task name which should be found in the view
      Returns:
      true if the given task is in the given view, otherwise false
      See Also:
      • isComponentNameSame(JPanel, SingleTask)
      • isComponentHasSameData(JPanel, SingleTask)
      • addTask(SingleTask)
      • deleteTask(SingleTask)
      • isTaskInWeekdayPlanner(SingleTask)

    • isTaskInWeekdayPlanner

      public boolean isTaskInWeekdayPlanner(SingleTask task)
      Checks if a given task is in a weekday planner view. If the given task is null, it returns false. Then it gets a weekday planner view based on the weekday's name of the task and then calls the isTaskInWeekdayPlanner(WeekdayPlannerView, SingleTask) method.
      Parameters:
      task - a given task which should be checked
      Returns:
      true if the given task is in a weekday planner view, otherwise false
      See Also:
      • TaskAddingDialogController.isTaskAdded(SingleTask)
      • TaskEditingDialogController.isTaskEdited(SingleTask, SingleTask)
      • deleteTask(SingleTask)
      • editTask(SingleTask, SingleTask)
